Description: Dunn did not play in Sunday's playoff game (June 6) against the 76ers.
Goodwin will miss the rest of the season due to a respiratory condition.
Hunter did not play in Sunday's playoff game (June 6) against Philadelpia.
Reddish is closing in on a return and starting to do full five-on-five full-court scrimmages, according Kevin Chouinard of the Hawks.com.
The Celtics announced that Brown had surgery and will return to basketball activities in approximately three months.
Dinwiddie had a ACL reconstruction of his right knee, according to Brian Lewis of the New York Post. He will miss the rest of the season.
Green is out for Monday's (June 7) game against Milwaukee.
Harden is out for Monday's (June 7) game against Milwaukee.
Dellavedova is expected to miss the remainder of the season, according to Chris Fedor of Cleveland.com.
The Cavaliers announced F Taurean Prince will undergo season ending ankle surgery.
The Cavaliers announced that Windler underwent surgery and is out indefinitely.
The Mavericks have listed Redick as OUT for Sunday's playoff game (June 6) against the Clippers.
Barton is out for Monday's (June 7) game against Phoenix.
Nuggets coach Michael Malone said there's no timetable for Dozier's return.
The Nuggets announced that Murray tore his left ACL. He will miss the rest of the season.
Thompson's recovery from a torn right Achilles tendon is right on schedule, according to Connor Letourneau of the San Francisco Chronicle. He's out of a walking boot and starting mobility exercises.
The Warriors announced that Wiseman will miss the rest of the season.
Wall will miss the remainder of the season due to a hamstring injury, according to Shams Charania of The Athletic.
Warren underwent foot surgery and will miss the rest of the season, according to Scott Agness of the Fieldhouse Files.
Ibaka did not play in Sunday's playoff game (June 6) against the Mavericks.
Oladipo could be cleared for full contact in November, according to Adrian Wojnarowski of ESPN.
DiVincenzo suffered a tendon injury in his foot and will miss the rest of the playoffs, according to Shams Charania of The Athletic.
The Timberwolves announced Culver will undergo season-ending ankle surgery.
The Knicks announced that Robinson suffered a fractured foot and is out indefinitely.
Fultz will miss the rest of the season with a torn ACL in his left knee, according to Adrian Wojnarowski.

Isaac is making progress with his rehab. He's started to ramp up his on-court work, according to Roy Parry of the Orlando Sentinel. He's not slated to return this season, but should be ready to go for the 2021-2022 season.
Alexander did not play in Thursday's game (June 3).
Nader underwent a procedure on his right knee and remains out indefinitely, according to Kellan Olson of ArizonaSports.com.

Collins is rehabbing after having surgery to repair a stress fracture in his ankle, according to a report from NBC Sports Northwest. If everything goes to plan, there's a chance he could return in time for the playoffs.
The Jazz announced that Conley has a mild right hamstring strain.
The Wizards announced that Avdija has a right fibular hairline fracture and is expected to make a full recovery in 12 weeks.
The Wizards announced that Bryant had surgery to repair his left ACL. He's not expected to play again this season.
